item.title: Jon add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "Did you ever want to set someone's head on fire, just to see what it looked like? Did you ever stand in the street and think to yourself, I could make that nun go blind just by giving her a kiss? Did you ever lay out plans for stitching babies and stray cats into a Perfect New Human? Did you ever stand naked surrounded by people who want your gleaming sperm, squirting frankincense, soma and testosterone from every pore? If so, then you're the bastard who stole my drugs Friday night. And I'll find you. Oh, yes." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Jon add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jon add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jon add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Jon add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jon add a quote by Mike Mignola
item.description: "Don't mess with me, lady. I've been drinking with skeletons." -- Mike Mignola

item.title: Jon add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jon add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them." -- Kurt Vonnegut
